text: Mararikulam railway station (Code: MAKM) is a railway station in Alappuzha District, Kerala that falls under the Thiruvananthapuram railway division of the Southern Railway Zone, Indian Railways. The station is a minor station on the Ernakulam-Kayamkulam coastal railway line. It is an NSG 5 category station. The station is operated by the Southern Railway zone of the Indian Railways and comes under the Thiruvananthapuram railway division. == History == Mararikulam railway station falls under the Ernakulam South -Alappuzha coastal railway line which opened on 16 October 1989. The railway line was later extended to Kayamkulam in 1992.The station is also a major point of single line crossing with trains often taking unscheduled stops at the station. But a few trains have scheduled stops here. == Layout == Mararikulam railway station has 3 rail lines with only 1 having platforms access to handle long distance and passenger trains. The station is also a major point of single line crossing with trains often taking unscheduled stops at the station. One of the siding also act as a Refuge siding. The platform has a capacity to accommodate trains with 24 coaches. == See also == * List of railway stations in Kerala ==References== Category:Railway stations in Alappuzha district Category:Railway stations opened in 1989
